Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Axillary Treatment in Breast Cancer Patients with Positive Sentinel Node Biopsy

Participants.evidence: operable unifocal invasive breast cancer (5â€“30 mm) and clinically negative lymph nodes

Intervention.evidence: randomized to either ALND or ART

Objective.evidence: investigates whether axillary lymph node dissection (ALND) or axillary radiotherapy (ART) is more effective

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the sentinel node identification rate

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was centralized by the EORTC headquarters

Number_Randomised.evidence: randomized 2,000 patients... The study was conducted in 26 European institutions between 2001 and 2005

Number_Analysed.evidence: The analysis was performed on 1,953 eligible patients using an intention-to-treat approach

Result_Outcome.evidence: The sentinel node identification rate was 97% (1,888/1,953)

Harms.evidence: No adverse events related to the SNB procedure were reported
